reviews.review: perfect set up for End Game, several great story lines come together for some epic fights. Blending and mixing the various super hero's from the MCU made for some great character moments.

This movie is the culmination of a solid decade's worth of build up and it pays off in such a magnificent way; the fights, music, & the (at the time) shocking ending will leave any comic book lover or superhero lover just stunned and amazed. Even though I still cry whenever I see a certain character get killed off, I still go back to watch this wonderful movie from time to time
Love the characters (duh) but WAY too manipulative ending.  I left the theater wanting to punch the writers.

Im watched infinity wars for the first time today, late to the party i know. Unfortunaly, i spoted a plot hole so massive a fleet of death stars could fly through. It kinda makes all of end game, and everyones deaths completly meaningless. 1st Gamora tried to kill Thanos with a knife in the begaining. Thanos is mortal so this would have worked, if not for the reality stone. The plot hole comes in around 1 hour 50 minutes in. Durring the fight with Thanos, Iron man, and the others had him completly immobile, both physicaly, and mentally, completly unable to use any of the stones. Instead of failing to pull the guantlet off, a simple knife to the neck would have ended Thanos. I guess the writters were more worried about star lords relixation that Gamora was dead, than staying consistant. Somehow the smatest man alive, the sorrcerer supreme, the others, the writers, and the enitre adduiance were unable to figgure out, what took me 3 seconds. Thats not funny. I expect more from humans. Its emmbarasing, your stupidity is making me look bad. Please do better with phase 4, this is just bad writting. It looked cool though, so ill still watch end game. Its good to know that someone that workd for marvel is doing their job, because the writers arent. I could do better in my sleep.

The first of a 2-part conclusion, and without a doubt, the best of all 22 movies. Lots of action, and lots of unexpected character pairings that keep the viewer hooked. It's worth suffering through all of the mediocre films to get to this point.

This is easily the move I've seen the most in my entire live.  Robert Downey Jr - I would rarely say this to another man but I absolutely love you.  The scene with Tom Holland (Love you too!!!) at the end when Spiderman is fading away is absolutely gut-wrenching.  

If it was still in the theatre, I'd see it at least twice more.
Taking the franchise to the next level thats why you have to support the other movies to get amazing ones like this.
While the buildup from previous films has been exciting, the action we were all waiting for was non-existent, and as shallow as the plot.

Talk about subversion of expectation!
This is the movie of the century
The hero of the hero's movies
